column4: Can anyone help me with my sound on my Acer laptop, sound driver seems to be ok but no sound from the speakers!
I have an acer, and I'll try to help.  have you checked for things being muted by default?
yes I have the device is HDA Nvidia
have you had any noises out of it at all from ubuntu?
no, i'm running 7.04 by the way
is there a volume control applet in the top right of your screen (picture of a speaker)?
I'll presume it's set to a reasonable volume.  let me have a dig around.  Can you go through the menu  "System->Preferences->Sound" and try the test buttons
yep, and test gives no sound

if you click on the box to the left of the test button you should have a choice of devices; I don't have the same hardware as you, so I can't tell what will be there, but can you try those options and test?
oh bum. what is the exact model of laptop?

os[Linux 2.6.20-15-generic i686]  distro[Debian 4.0]  cpu[1 x AMD Turion(tm) 64 Mobile Technology MK-36 @ 800MHz]  mem[Physical : 883MB, 77.0% free]  disk[Total : 19.74GB, 84.50% Free]  video[nVidia Corporation C51 PCI Express Bridge]  sound[]
I meant what model of Acer is it: for googling purposes
have you tried the headphone slot?
the link in the page I linked to is broken: this is the correct version https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HdaIntelSoundHowto?highlight=%28hda%29
